div.p: I have the honor to state as a preface to my investigation of The case of alleged brutality and robery by colored troops, that one of the two companies connected with my department is on President Island, and that it is so improbable that They could have participated in This outrage, owing to their peculiar situation, that I did not think it necessary to institue a serch in that camp__ If however no clue can be had to the perpetrators, and it is thought necessary I can do so yet, at any time
The Company at Camp Holly Springs I have examined, and find no men answering to that of the parties said to have been
implicated; neither could I find in the houses of the soldiers any property that could possibly be identicle with that men- tioned in the list recd from the detectiff
As many of the families of soldiers from the regiments in and around the city are in the camp last named__ it is not improbable that the stolen goods may be secreted in the camp
